lines.text: Nucleus emits alpha particle (2 protons, 2 neutrons)
Because number of protons decreases by 2
Neutrinos: Particles with practically no mass

secText:
Lesson:
1. Describe [OBJ:expsec_v067:radioactive decay].
2. Define [OBJ:expsec_v068:alpha radiation].
3. Define [OBJ:expsec_v069:negative beta radiation].
4. [OBJ:expsec_v070:Apply] the concept of the strong force to alpha radiation.
5. [OBJ:expsec_v071:Apply] the concept of the weak force to beta radiation.
6. Describe [OBJ:expsec_v072:neutrinos].
7. [OBJ:expsec_v073:Apply] the concept of neutrinos to the weak force.
8. Define [OBJ:expsec_v074:half-life and radioactive decay].
9. Determine the [OBJ:expsec_v075:probability] of radioactive decay over time.
10. [OBJ:actsec_wr40:Experiment] with radioactive decay of a material.
11. [OBJ:actsec_wr41:Experiment] with radioactive decay by being a CSI.
